title: Cat. 83.4  A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe, 1894
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe  
1894  
Second state of two  
Wood-block print in brown ink on cream wove Japanese paper, laid down on cream wove Japanese paper; 204 × 140 mm (image/primary/secondary support)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.251  
Guérin 46, Kornfeld 33 II/II  
For the verso, see fig. 83.4.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Gustave Fayet (1865–1925), Béziers and Carcassonne, France, by 1925.

Sold to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, for Edward McCormick Blair (1915–2010), Chicago, Feb. 23, 1983.

Given by Edward McCormick Blair to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, Sept. 6, 2003–Jan. 11, 2004, cat. 25.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Marc Chadourne, Marehurehu: Entre le jour et la nuit (Librairie de France, 1925), n.pag. (ill.).

Marcel Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980), cat. 46.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 148, cat. 33.

Art Institute of Chicago, Intimate Encounters: Paul Gauguin and the South Pacific; The Edward McCormick Blair Collection, exhibition brochure (Art Institute of Chicago, 2003), cat. 25.

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Marc Chadourne, Marehurehu: Entre le jour et la nuit (Librairie de France, 1925), n.pag. (ill.), plates reproduced in this book are from the collection of Gustave Fayet. Also see Marcel Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980), cat. 46. Also according to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, invoice addressed to Edward Blair, Sr., Feb. 23, 1983, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

According to Alice Adam Ltd., Chicago, invoice addressed to Edward Blair, Sr., Feb. 23, 1983, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 83.4 A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe, 1894.

fig. 83.4.1 Verso of Gauguin’s A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe, 1894. The Art Institute of Chicago, 2002.251

</section>
